FuncDef: The display evpn vpn-instance mac-duplication command displays information about suppression on MAC route flapping. The display evpn vpn-instance mac-duplication command displays information about suppression on MAC route flapping. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display evpn vpn-instance name <vpn-instance-name> mac-duplication [ bridge-domain <bd-id> ] [ mac-address <mac-address> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays a BD ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Displays a MAC address.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0.

Displays the name of an EVPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.
This value should be the same as BD ID.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display evpn vpn-instance name evpna mac-duplication
